title: Project Architect Job at Kloverharris Limited
content:
Kloverharris Limited is a Human resource/IT Consulting company that provides high quality services to businesses across Africa. We pride ourselves in how well we assist organizations overcome challenges that bother on optimal performance by proffering a wide array of solutions through the use of deep IT expertise, industry- wide expertise and highly proficient tools.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positiomn: Project Architect
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1 (Admiralty Way), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Project Architect to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in architectural design and project management, with the ability to lead projects from concept through completion.
	This is a great opportunity to work in a collaborative environment on a variety of exciting projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage architectural projects from design through construction.
	Prepare detailed drawings, plans, and specifications using AutoCAD, Revit, and other tools.
	Coordinate with consultants, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely project delivery.
	Conduct site visits and monitor construction to ensure design and quality standards are met.
	Ensure compliance with all building codes, zoning laws, and regulations.
	Provide leadership and technical guidance to junior team members


Requirements


	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture.
	Minimum of 7–8 years of experience in architectural design and project execution.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, and other architectural software.
	Strong understanding of building codes and construction methodologies.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Registration with ARCON or other relevant professional body is a plus.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
	Collaborative and innovative work environment.
	Exposure to diverse and high-profile projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Recruitment@kloverharris.com using ''Project Architect'' as the subject of the email.

title: Brand Manager Job at Awake to Power Communications
content:
Awake to Power Communications - We empower Corps Members with digital skills and connect them with opportunities, enabling them to monetize their skills and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a creative, strategic, and hands-on Brand Manager to lead brand storytelling, drive awareness, and manage visual communications across all channels.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for shaping the public perception of the brand through compelling content, including short videos, reels, promotional materials, and digital campaigns.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement comprehensive brand strategies aligned with business goals
	Create engaging multimedia content for social media, websites, and other digital platforms
	Shoot, edit, and produce high-quality videos for marketing, brand campaigns, and internal use
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, product, and management to support promotional activities
	Manage social media presence in line with brand identity and business objectives
	Lead the development of brand guidelines and ensure consistent application across all touchpoints
	Monitor market trends, audience insights, and competitor activity to refine brand messaging
	Oversee performance of brand campaigns and generate reports to track brand health and engagement


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, Media Production, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in brand management, content development, and video editing.
	Proven expertise in video production tools (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro)
	Strong portfolio demonstrating creativity and proficiency in storytelling through visual media.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.
	Ability to work onsite full-time from the Lekki Phase 1 office.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@awaketopowercom.com using "Application - Brand Manager" as the subject of the email.

title: Software Engineer in Test (SDET) Job at Apex Network
content:
Apex Network is a Financial servicing firm, where anyone anywhere can easily and securely transact Bitcoin, which is the future of Money and a catalyst for creating and open financial system in Africa and the World.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer in Test (SDET)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Senior QA Engineer, you will champion quality across our distributed systems.
	Partnering with engineering (Golang, Laravel), frontend (VueJS), and API teams, you’ll design and execute test strategies, build automation frameworks, and ensure our micro-services ecosystem meets reliability and performance standards.


Requirements


	Develop and maintain comprehensive test plans: functional, regression, integration, API, and UI
	Design, implement, and scale automated test frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Postman, or equivalent)
	Collaborate with developers to define testable acceptance criteria and improve testability
	Execute manual and automated test suites, analyze results, and report defects
	Perform performance, load, and stress testing on microservices and APIs
	Establish and monitor quality metrics (e.g., test coverage, defect rates, MTTR)
	Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)
	Mentor junior QA engineers and drive best practices in test automation and quality engineering


Qualifications


	 5+ years of QA experience in software engineering environments
	Strong proficiency in test automation tools and frameworks for API and UI testing
	Experience testing microservices architectures and RESTful/gRPC APIs
	Familiarity with Golang and Laravel codebases—able to write basic test scripts or helpers
	Hands-on experience with frontend testing in VueJS applications
	Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and integrating test suites
	Skilled in defect tracking tools (Jira, GitHub Issues) and version control (Git)
	Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
	Strong communication and collaboration mindset


Stand-Out Qualities:


	Background in fintech or e-commerce platforms
	Knowledge of performance testing tools (k6, JMeter, Locust)
	Experience with containerized testing environments (Docker)
	Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana)
	Security testing experience (SAST/DAST toools).


Benefits


	Competitive salary and equity options
	Flexible working hours and remote-first culture
	Comprehensive health insurance package
	Collaborative and inclusive team environment.
